parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The provided post does not contain a CMF number.  While the absence of a CMF number doesn't automatically exclude it from being considered electoral propaganda, it suggests it might not be officially sanctioned campaign material.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly mentions USR and PNL, two political parties participating in the parliamentary elections.  It also implicitly refers to PSD by suggesting a connection between voting for USR/PNL and voting for PSD. This directly relates to "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>The post is a paid Facebook advertisement, inherently designed to reach a wide audience.  The targeting parameters (age, location, gender) further confirm its intention to address a broad segment of the population. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The core message "Votezi USR sau votezi PNL = Votezi PSD!" aims to influence voters' choices by suggesting that voting for USR or PNL is equivalent to voting for PSD. This is a clear attempt to sway public opinion and discourage votes for USR and PNL, thus fulfilling "Article 36 (7) - c". The objective is undeniably electoral.</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post lacks any journalistic objectivity or attempt at balanced reporting. It presents a biased and simplistic equation between parties, lacking evidence or context. It does not adhere to journalistic standards.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The statement is not a personal opinion; it's a direct appeal to influence voting behavior, presented as a factual statement without substantiation.  It's not an expression of personal belief but a political tactic.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>615078284376981</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The Facebook post, with the message "Votezi USR sau votezi PNL = Votezi PSD!", constitutes electoral propaganda. It directly refers to specific parliamentary candidates (parties USR, PNL, and implicitly PSD), targets a wide audience through a paid advertisement, and has the clear objective of influencing voters' choices by creating a negative association between USR/PNL and PSD.  The post lacks journalistic integrity and presents a biased, unsubstantiated claim. The fact that it's a paid advertisement further strengthens the argument that it's intended to influence the election outcome.  The post's targeting parameters show a focus on Constanța County, suggesting a localized campaign to influence voters there.  The spend is less than RON 100, but even small amounts can have an impact.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>USR</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>PNL</name><impact>NEGATIVE</impact></candidate>
  <candidate><name>PSD</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>INDEPENDENT</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
Claudiu-Iorga Palaz, pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea pe Facebook, după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, a unei postări plătite (ID 615078284376981) cu mesajul "Votezi USR sau votezi PNL = Votezi PSD!",  care constituie propagandă electorală interzisă după încheierea campaniei.  Mesajul vizează direct alegerile parlamentare, influențând negativ votul pentru USR și PNL și pozitiv pentru PSD, printr-o afirmație nefondată și tendențioasă.  Postarea, având o rază de cuprindere de peste 1 milion de persoane,  a fost direcționată către județul Constanța, conform datelor din Ad Library, cu un buget sub 100 RON,  și utilizează datele de contact miscareapopulara.constanta@gmail.com și +40720888888.  Efectul electoral este clar, având ca scop manipularea alegătorilor prin asocierea falsă a USR și PNL cu PSD.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
